sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Penitential
Poenitentiale, etc. (Lat.-Sax.)
msDesc.p: Vellum, 285 185 11.5 x 7.6, ff. 2 + 4 + 212 + 2, varying numbers of lines to a page. Cent. xi, in several fine hands.

Volume I: The first four leaves contain the Table given by Nasmith.
Volume II: The hand is at first large and black, and after a single change of script (probably) a small and delicate hand appears (p. 320) and continues with a few interruptions to the end.
Volume III: Mostly in a hand similar to that of no. 22 sqq.
Collation: 2 small flyleaves pasted together. a4(?) 18-78 | gap | 88-188 19?6 (wants 4, 5) || 204 218-248 (wants 7) | 258-288 (wants 3, 7, 8) | 2 flyleaves.
The book is from Exeter. At top of p. 1r (xvi) is: Ex ... us (probably for Exoniensis).
In large letters on the verso of the flyleaf (p. i): Penitencialis Theodori archi. epi. The word Theodori has been in part re-written.

This is identified by Wanley with the book presented by Leofric to the Church of Exeter and entered in the list of his gifts as Scrift boc on Englisc. In MS 265 certain passages supplied from it are said to be from a codex Exoniensis.
A copy of this MS. made in 1656 by John Retchford for Mr. Cornelius Bee is MS. Harl. 438 (Miss Bateson, Engl. Hist. Rev. 1895, p. 715 note).
In the article just cited Miss Bateson gives a most valuable study of this MS. on pp. 715-720, showing the many discrepancies between the table of chapters and the text.
I have thought it well to append a summary of her account, as follows:
Wilkins and Thorpe printed their version of the Excerptiones Egberti from the Cotton MS. Nero A. 1. Johnson translated them and compared them with the collections in MS 265. Lord Selborne in his Ancient Facts and Fictions about Tithes compared these two latter MSS. in further detail. The MS. 190 forms an interesting link between the two. It appears to have escaped attention owing to the misleading nature of the table of contents.
Thorpe printed as far as the 43rd (44th) chapter de Reconciliatione.
No break here, p. 94; then follows Item de reconc. and a passage from a Nicene Canon.
Two long passages not noted in the index:
a. Rubric. In nomine Domini. Primo omnium admonemus omnes homines ut super omnia ... percipere mereatur sempiternam. Amen.
b. Space for Rubric. Ecclesia sponsa Christi est et omnium domina. Against the spoilers of the church: cases of Pompey and Alaric quoted.
p. 97. cap. 45. Clerus grece, sors latine (cf. Nero A. 1, f. 127r).
46 resembles Thorpe's Excerpt § 161.
45-50 are concerned with election and ordination of bishops and priests.
47 resembles closely MS 265, pp. 4-7.
49 excerpts from the first Nicene Council: contains Thorpe Excerpt 98, 99.
50 from the Council of Agde 544, cap. 35.
51 quotes Beda on the history of the pallium.
p. 105. 52 resembles Thorpe 44: a passage from Gregory added.
53. Council of Chalcedon cap. 2, with Thorpe 33.
54. Quicunque dignitatem gradus non custodierit, with quotations from O. T.
55 quotes Popes St Alexander and Felix.
p. 109. 56. From Gregory to Johannes Defensor (P. L. LXXVII 1294).
57. Sunt quidam sancte dei ecclesie inimici, complains that some deny force to the clerical oath: quotes Pope Pelagius.
58. Gregorius ait. Scimus itaque quia vita presulum nulli; breaks off.
Capp. 59, 60, 61, 62, 63 lost.
p. 111. Latter half of Thorpe, 60.
Thorpe, 61-85.
Three sentences, beginning Si homo uexatus a diabolo, which resemble the genuine Theodore, Lib. II x § 1, 2, 3; also in MS 265, p. 71.
Thorpe, 86-97.
Passage on tithes, de jure sacerdotali; also in MS 265.
Thorpe, 101-127.
Rubrication begins again at cap. 104, Thorpe.
p. 124. Quotation from Pope Leo to Rusticus of Narbonne.
Excerpts 128-130, 134, 146 (called Can. Bonan. for Roman.), 135-140.
Then the break; 2 pages left blank and subsequently filled in; see above, p. 458, arts. 5-9.
p. 134-8. Excerpts 132, 133, 147-160.
p. 138. 1st Nicene council, cap. 3, more fully than in excerpt 31.
Excerpt 32.
From this point there is no further resemblance to the excerpts.
Passages with rubric Alia. Multis autem declaratur exemplis (that clerics should not bear arms). De militia et victoria christianorum etc.
p. 139. On the captivity of the Jews, followed by the Alcuin passages; see above.
Then the nature of the contents changes.
Miss Bateson proceeds to show that the index of the MS. is discrepant with the contents, a discrepancy of much interest, since the index tells us that what is missing is that mysterious work Capitula de sacerdotali jure Egcberti archiepiscopi. After cap. 63 (64), on the analogy of Nero A. 1 and MS 265 we expect that titles applicable to the Capitulary in 21 chapters will follow, but this does not happen. The list (of 25 chapters) begins with 1. Item Canones Sanctorum and ends with 25. Ut ab alterius episcopo nullus crisma accipiat.
The index proceeds 26 De coniugio and here the contents of the MS. begin to answer the description of the index. This title may well cover the excerpts 113-20.
The next, 27. Item de legitimo coniugio = Exc. 121-125
28 = 126
29 = 127
30. Leonis pape (cf. Hinschius, Ps. Isidor, p. 615, cap. 4) is not in Nero A. 1.
31 = 128-9
32 = 130
33 = 146
34 = 134-140
35 = 132-3
Here again the index breaks down, making no note of Exec. 147-151.
36 = 152-3
No note is made of Exec. 154-160. The rest of the titles in the index tally with those of the text.
The meaning of these discrepancies, and especially the relation of capp. 1-25 to the title which alleges them to be of Egbert's authorship, I cannot explain. But no discussion of the authorship of the work De Iure Sacerdotali is complete without a reference to this manuscript.

There are three main portions of the book: the first consists of 19 quires (20 including the preliminary one) and is in Latin. It contains Nasmith's articles 1-18. The second contains nos. 19-29: the third the remainder.

p.supplied: James reproduces Nasmith's contents-list, which he printed from the eleventh-century contents-list of the manuscript; however this does not correspond exactly to the manuscript's actual contents. Therefore we have not included Nasmith's material in Volume I of this description. To view the Nasmith material for this section, follow the link to the .pdf reproduction of the James catalogue.

head.title: Hymn for the consecration of the oils at the main Mass on Maundy Thursday

msItem.ab: On the verso of the flyleaf is a hymn (for the hallowing of the Chrism) with neumes
msItem.incipit: O redemptor sume carmen temet concinentium
Audi iudex mortuorum una spes mortalium
msItem.ab: Hoc ecclesia fundatur. Credentes glori(ficat ?). Sit hoc crisma benedictum. cunctis saluberrimum.
The first four leaves contain the Table with titles in red capitals
The headings are: capitula de penitentium (i-lxiii), de canonibus (but no capp. follow), de sacerdotali Iure Egcberti Archiep. (i-xcviiii), de libro scintillarum. Ending lxxii. de Anticristo

head.title: Extract from Pope Gregory the Great

ab.supplied: Old English gloss on p. 17 is Cameron C89.2

head.title: Wulfstan's Canon Law Collection ('Excerptiones pseudo-Egberti', recension B, partial text)

msItem.ab: The text continues with Thorpe cxxxii, cxxxiii and then passes to Thorpe cxlvii-clx
This comprises xxxv-xxxvii (part) of the capitula of Nasmith

msItem.incipit: Quod in unaquaque ecclesia cui episcopus preest tam de reditibus quam de fidelium oblationibus quattuor debeant fieri portiones etc.

head.title: Old English charm for recovering stolen chattels

msItem.incipit: Gyf feoh sy under fangen. Gyf hit sy hors sing on his feteran
msItem.explicit: for þam hi hyt forhelan ne mihtan

msItem.incipit: Ut nullus episcopus seruum alterius ad officium clericatus promoueat etc.
Si quis in seculari habitu uota uouerit

head.title: Decree on jurisdiction over the clergy

msItem.rubric: xxviiii. De eo quod non iudicandi sunt etc.
msItem.incipit: Constantinus rex ait ad episcopos
Non oportet iudices ecclesie habere timorem hominum etc.
msItem.rubric: Ut nullus accusati sedem usurpet episcopi
msItem.incipit: Gaudentius ep. dixit, addendum si placet

msItem.ab: De consanguinitate, a diagrammatic table extending over two pages 132, 133
This table is not in Thorpe

De militia et victoria Christianorum etc. to De tribulationibusThe text of this is conjecturally ascribed to Alcuin by Miss Bateson, and printed by her Eng. Hist. Rev. 1895, p. 731., p. 142, which ends
msItem.explicit: Dei est quippe et adiuuare et in fugam uertere

msItem.incipit: Missarum uero officium constat ex introitu
msItem.ab: (xliv in capitula) ending p. 151 (lxi de quinquagesima)

msItem.head: Ælfric OSB, Second Latin Pastoral Letter for Wulfstan
msItem.incipit: O sacerdotes domini

msItem.head: Wulfstan, Homily VIIIa
msItem.incipit: Primo necesse est ut paganus catecuminus sit
msItem.ab: Printed by Napier, Wulfstan, No. IV, p. 2

msItem.rubric: Incipit super electos ad catecuminum faciendum etc.
msItem.incipit: Officium quidem misse magna ex parte ad solum pertinet sacerdotem
Exalta in fortitudine uocem tuam
O karissime frater corde tenus perspice

msItem.head: Alcuin, Epistola 17
msItem.rubric: Epistola Albini leuite ad ÆðELNARDUMApparently altered from ÆðELDARDUM archiep.
msItem.incipit: Pio patri et sancte sedis presuli æþelhardo

msItem.head: Alcuin, Epistola 114
msItem.rubric: Item Epistola Alcuini ad Eanbaldum archiepiscopum
msItem.incipit: Ecce karissime fili
msItem.ab: These two letters, which occur again in MS 265, have been collated by Dümmler

msItem.head: Isidore of Seville, Extracts from Sententiae, book 3, chapters 36-38 (perhaps taken from pseudo-Amalarius, Institutio canonicorum, book 1, chapters 20, 29, and 30), and related texts
msItem.incipit: Tam doctrina quam uita etc.

head.title: Texts on ecclesiastical customs by Ælfric OSB, Hrabanus Maurus, Abbo of Saint-Germain-des-Prés and others

msItem.incipit: Ego uobis clericis mihi subditis
Hostiarii sunt idem et ianitores
msItem.ab: The section Item de Sacerdotibus, p. 204, = beginning of MS 265, p. 185. See also MS 265, pp. 188, 194

ab.supplied: Old English gloss on p. 246 is Cameron C82.2

msItem.rubric: Qualiter penitentes in cena domini in ecclesiam introducuntur
msItem.ab: In the form Qualiter penitentes in cena domini in ecclesiam introducuntur, p. 252, neumes occur
msItem.incipit: Vere fratres karissimi
msItem.ab: The sermon (p. 253) Vere fratres karissimi By Abbo of St Germain: D'Achery, Spicil. I 337 is in Anglo-Saxon on p. 354. Other portions also occur in Anglo-Saxon (see post). More neumes on pp. 258 and 259
msItem.explicit: et clamante diacono Ite missa est pergat unusquisque ad sua

msItem.head: Defensor of Ligugé, Liber scintillarum (extracts)
msItem.rubric: Incipiunt excerptiones ex libro scintillarum (72). In primis de caritate
msItem.incipit: Dominus dicit, Maiorem caritatem etc.
msItem.ab: There are a good many Anglo-Saxon interlinear glosses

ab.supplied: Old English gloss on pp. 265-266 is Cameron C60

msItem.head: Adso Dervensis OSB, De ortu et tempore antichristi
msItem.rubric: Epistola Adsonis Monachi ad Gerbergam reginam de Anticristo (ci 1291)
msItem.incipit: Excellentissimo ac regali dignitate pollenti

head.title: Capitula of the Council of Winchester 1070

ab.handNote: A round hand like that on p. 130 appears

msItem.incipit: Quod nulli liceat duobus episcopatibus presidere
msItem.ab: Wilkins, Concilia I 365. A copy in MS 117. 4 is described as being from a Worcester MS.

head.title: Capitula of the Council of Windsor 1070

msItem.rubric: Capitula concilii apud uuindlesora celebrati in pentecosten
msItem.incipit: De introitu episcoporum et abbatum per symoniacam heresim
msItem.explicit: qui hec non fecerit anathema sit
msItem.ab: I do not find this text in Wilkins

head.title: Penitential articles issued after the Battle of Hastings

msItem.rubric: De penitentia in bello homines occidentium
msItem.incipit: Hec est penitentie institutio secundum decreta normannorum presulum auctoritate summi pontificis confirmata per legatum suum ermenfredum episcopum sedunensem
msItem.explicit: ut neque ipsi uendant neque alii emant
msItem.ab: The lower part of p. 294 has been written upon, the writing erased, and the Latin Epistola de Canonibus Thorpe, 8vo, II 342 (Ælfric to Wulsin) written on it in cent. xvi (Wanley, p. 5). The old title is still decipherable as ABSOLUTIO

msItem.head: Ælfric OSB, Letter to Wulfsige

head.title: Epistola de canonibus Saxonice [scilicet Ælfrici ad sacerdotes]

ab.quote: cui premissa est epistola nuncupatoria ad Wulfinum episcopum, Latine et manu recenti

msItem.incipit: Ic secge eoƿ preostum

ab.ref: Thorpe, 8vo, II 342. The Canons of Ælfric

msItem.incipit: Ic bidde eoƿ þæt ge gymon eoƿra sylfra

msItem.head: Ælfric OSB, Catholic Homilies, Second Series, Apostles
msItem.incipit: In illo tempore. Designauit Dominus et alios
Se hælend gecéas hi to eacan
Heah hadas syndon to healdenne
msItem.ab: Also in MS 201, p. 108 and Junius, 121, f. 35v

msItem.head: Ælfric OSB, Preface to his Old English Letters to Wulfstan

head.title: Prologus venerabilis Ælfrici abbatis ad Wulstanum archiepiscopum, Latine

ab.ref: Wanley, p. 22, from a Bodleian MS.

msItem.incipit: Vs bisceopum gedafenað

msItem.incipit: Eala ge mæsse preostas
msItem.ab: Thorpe, 8vo, II 390 (quando dividis chrisma) from this MS.

msItem.head: Ælfric OSB, Second Old English Letter for Wulfstan (continued)

head.title: Sermo in cena Domini, et VI feria et sabbato sancto, Saxonice

msItem.incipit: In cena domini et in parasceue et in sancto sabbato. On þyssum þrym sƿigenihtum ge sceolan singan æt gædere
msItem.ab: Nos. 25, 26 seem not to have been printed

head.title: On the Mass: Celebration of Vigils
De officio missae in vigilia pascae, Saxonice

msItem.incipit: On þone haligan easter æfen gange man to nones
msItem.rubric: De officio missae in vigilia pentecosten
msItem.ab: Nos. 25, 26 seem not to have been printed
At this point a large hand appears
msItem.incipit: Gehyrað broðru þa leofestan ƿe mynegiað eoƿ
msItem.ab: Copied for Professor Napier; apparently only here

head.title: Sermo in cena Domini ad penitentes, Saxonice

msItem.ab: Copied for Professor Napier; apparently only here

head.title: Canons on the punishment of sins

msItem.ab: Followed on p. 360 by Latin extracts from Canons in a later hand
msItem.incipit: Excommunicati si perdurant in pristinis criminibus etc.

msItem.head: Serlo of Bayeux, De filiis presbyterorum
msItem.incipit: Lex inmortalis quam longo tempore talis
msItem.explicit: atque coheredem patrie reuocauit ad edem
msItem.ab: Th. Wright, Anglo-Latin Satirists, II 208 (another text, called Versus Seltonis), also Mon. Germ. Hist. Libelli de lite, III 580, with a facsimile of the MS.
An Excommunication form in fine large hand

head.title: Old English formula of confession and absolution
Liber confessionalis Ecgberti Eboracensis archiepiscopi, Saxonice, qui olim ex se conficiebat unum volumen; quod tandem vero una cum aliis diversis tractatibus in hunc librum compingebatur

msItem.ab: The first page (365) is in a large hand and contains an Anglo-Saxon Confession and Absolution
msItem.incipit:
Ic andette þe drihten aelmihtig god etc.
Gemyltsige eoƿ se aelmihtiga god etc.

msItem.rubric: Her onginnað ðisse boce capitulas ðe ƿe hatað scrift boc
msItem.ab: This MS. is taken by Thorpe as the basis of his text (folio edn, p. 343: 8vo II 128)
msItem.incipit: Þeodorus se mæra bisceop ge sette þas rædinge to bysene
msItem.ab: Thorpe's Poenitentiale Liber I begins p. 387a

msItem.head: Chrodegang, Regula canonicorum, chapter 83 (Old English version)

head.title: Formulas and Directions for the Use of Confessors
Anglo-Saxon Laws Mirce, Að, and Hadbot

msItem.ab: On pp. 418-420 in a smaller hand are the texts of Be Mercena lage, Be gehadendra aðe 7 be hadbote printed by Liebermann, Gesetze, 462 sqq.
